title: David Fernández Borbalán
text:
David Fernández Borbalán (born 30 May 1973) is a retired Spanish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Referee%20%28association%20football%29">referee</a>. His first match officiating in <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> was on 12 September 2004, between <a href="Levante%20UD">Levante UD</a> and <a href="Racing%20de%20Santander">Racing de Santander</a>.
Borbalán also refereed a key match in <a href="Synot%20liga">Synot liga</a> season 2014–15 between <a href="AC%20Sparta%20Prague">AC Sparta Prague</a> and <a href="FC%20Viktoria%20Plze%C5%88">FC Viktoria Plzeň</a> on 9 May 2015.
He was chosen, upon validation from <a href="FIFA">FIFA</a>, to referee the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Greek%20Football%20Cup%23Final">2018 Greek Cup Final</a> between <a href="AEK%20Athens%20F.C.">AEK</a> and <a href="PAOK%20FC">PAOK</a> at the <a href="Olympic%20Stadium%20%28Athens%29">Olympic Stadium</a> in <a href="Athens">Athens</a>, amidst concerns over supporter riots and violence during the game and despite protests by Greek football chairmen and refereeing bodies over the appointment of non-Greek officials. Two weeks later, he took charge of his final La Liga fixture, a 1–0 win for <a href="RCD%20Espanyol">RCD Espanyol</a> over <a href="Athletic%20Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a> at <a href="San%20Mam%C3%A9s%20Stadium%20%282013%29">San Mamés</a> in a match which meant little to the fortunes of the teams involved but was played at a venue specified as being preferred by the referee for his last appointment.
